thread.title: Monsoon bringing heavy rain to Top End
thread.title_full: Monsoon bringing heavy rain to Top End

title: Monsoon bringing heavy rain to Top End
text:
Photo: Heavy rain is forecast for Darwin on the weekend. (ABC News: Xavier La Canna) 
Weather forecasters are predicting a monsoon will bring heavy falls and winds to the Top End by the weekend. 
Senior forecaster with the Bureau of Meteorology (BOM), Graeme King, said there was an almost 100 per cent chance of rain on the weekend in Darwin. 
"That monsoon trough, it is right on the north coast now," Mr King said. 
"It strengthens up over the next day or so, so by the time we get into the weekend it is almost 100 per cent chance of rain and gusty squalls and all sorts of good monsoonal weather. 
"It seriously looks like a good monsoon." 
Monsoons are associated with wetter weather, more cloud and cooler temperatures. 
Mr King said it was difficult to know exactly where the monsoon would be focused. 
"Once it starts focusing you do get some heavy falls, [but we] can't tell where that is going to happen yet," he said. 
The wind is also likely to be strong. 
"Once that westerly surge arrives some time later tomorrow or Saturday we will start to see those winds really ramp-up," Mr King said. First posted February 02, 2017 11:08:00 Top Stories
